task.title: Create API tests in
task.shortdesc: This section shows you how to create API tests in .

taskbody.context: To create API tests in , do as follows:

step.cmd: Open a Katalon project in . See Open a project.
Create a new RESTful endpoint at Object Repository: go to Object Repository > New > Web Service Request.

image.alt: Create new RESTful endpoint at Object Repository

info.p: At the Create New Web Service Request dialog, you can either choose to create a RESTful or a SOAP request.
Request type is a required field. You need to specify it exactly at this step. In contrast, URL is not required. You can set this value later in the next step.

image.alt: Create new RESTful endpoint at Object Repository

info.p: Click OK, then we are ready to input more details to the first RESTful test.

step.cmd: Create a new test case with an existing request.

info.p: While the request at Object Repository is helpful for fast testing, we can add the request verification at the test case level for better managing and reporting.

step.cmd: Add an existing request to a test case.
step.info: A request can be inserted into a test case with Web service built-in keywords. There are many keywords can be used to send the request, to verify the response, and to make the request as part of a bigger testing flow.

info.p: Following test case illustrates how we can call the request with verification steps from a test case:

image.alt: Verify the RESTful object in a test case

info.p: The test case can be executed as a normal test case in . Each verification step can be viewed from the log.

step.cmd: Add the test case to the test suite.

info.p: A test case can be added to a test suite via either the drag-and-drop feature or the Add test case tool. Once the test case is added to the test suite, we can execute the whole test suite with the Run button (without selecting the browser as in UI testing).

image.alt: Add test case to a test suite
